articles.headline: Hunt for 3 G.I.’s in Iraq Slowed by False Trails
articles.snippet: Thousands of soldiers, sifting through hundreds of tips, are searching for the three missing Americans.
articles.abstract: Thousands of soldiers, sifting through hundreds of tips, are searching for the three missing Americans.
articles.lead_paragraph: RUSHDIMULLAH, Iraq, May 17 — The stories have come in by the dozens.

articles.headline: In Deal for Chrysler, Snow’s Role Extends a Trend
articles.snippet: John W. Snow, former Treasury secretary, is one of the latest politicians hired by private equity for their government connections and skills.
articles.abstract: John W. Snow, former Treasury secretary, is one of the latest politicians hired by private equity for their government connections and skills.
articles.lead_paragraph: At a news conference this week in Stuttgart, Germany, the usually secretive private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management was in the spotlight, announcing an agreement to take control of Chrysler.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Fed Chief Addresses Foreclosures
articles.snippet: Ben S. Bernanke said problems in the subprime market were unlikely to have a major effect on the economy.
articles.abstract: Ben S. Bernanke said problems in the subprime market were unlikely to have a major effect on the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve does not foresee a broader economic impact from the growing number of mortgage defaults and home foreclosures, its chairman said yesterday. And he cautioned that heavy-handed regulation of lenders could have the unintended effect of adding to the strain on the troubled housing market.

articles.headline: An Export Boom Suddenly Facing a Quality Crisis
articles.snippet: China is facing international pressure to prove that its food exports are safe, weeks after a tainted pet food case.
articles.abstract: China is facing international pressure to prove that its food exports are safe, weeks after a tainted pet food case.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI, May 17 — Weeks after tainted Chinese pet food ingredients killed and sickened thousands of dogs and cats in the United States, this country is facing growing international pressure to prove that its food exports are safe to eat.

articles.headline: A Fired Boss Seeks His Revenge
articles.snippet: If a chief executive is fired, should his fellow shareholders let him pick new directors to replace those who ousted him?
articles.abstract: If a chief executive is fired, should his fellow shareholders let him pick new directors to replace those who ousted him?
articles.lead_paragraph: If a chief executive is fired for fraudulently taking travel money from the company, and then turns out to have been involved in backdating options grants, should his fellow shareholders let him pick new directors to replace those who ousted him?

articles.headline: Michelle Obama Adds New Role to Balancing Act
articles.snippet: A woman who has said she dislikes politics is assuming a starring role in her husband’s presidential campaign.
articles.abstract: A woman who has said she dislikes politics is assuming a starring role in her husband’s presidential campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was a triumphant moment for Barack Obama: He was walking through the Capitol for the very first time as a United States senator in January 2005, trailed by photographers, hangers-on, and finally, his amused wife. Rolling her eyes as she pulled a reporter aside, Michelle Obama said, “Maybe one day, he will do something to warrant all this attention.”
articles.byline: By Jodi Kantor and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Auditing Rule Is Put at Risk by Texas Bill
articles.snippet: Texas lawmakers are on the verge of rejecting a requirement that state and local governments disclose the cost of the health care they have promised to retired employees.
articles.abstract: Texas lawmakers are on the verge of rejecting a requirement that state and local governments disclose the cost of the health care they have promised to retired employees.
articles.lead_paragraph: Texas lawmakers are on the verge of rejecting a requirement that state and local governments disclose the cost of the health care they have promised to retired employees.
